commit.message: TSK-1349: init test file for workbasket details
TSK-1349: added test cases for workbasket information
TSK-1349: init test file for workbasket details
TSK-1349: added test cases for workbasket information
TSK-1349: moved data to mock-store, extend workbasket information tests

nodes.bodyText: What do you think about unifying the names for better understanding? I like engineConfigurationMock - maybe we can add 'mock' in the end of every mock? workbasketReadStateMock or something like that? (I mean renaming in the mock-store.ts file)
I thought we don't want to test code which is executed every time. Was that by accident or did you have a reason? You don't have to change anything - I just want to understand.
This is not our naming convention.
There is no async in the method declaration despite of the subscription.
There is no async in the method declaration despite of the subscription.
You could also delete the variable showDetail in the ts file as it is no longer used.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2,11 +2,6 @@
     <taskana-shared-spinner [isRunning]="requestInProgress"></taskana-shared-spinner>
     <div id="workbasket-details" *ngIf="workbasket && !requestInProgress">
         <ul class="nav nav-tabs" role="tablist">
-            <li *ngIf="showDetail" class="visible-xs visible-sm hidden">

nodes.bodyText: Why do we not need this anymore?
This is not our naming convention
I think you didn't mean 'copied workbasket' 😀
